document.docAuthor: Cumming, Heather J. & Wheeler, Terry A.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Nearctic species of Callomyia Meigen (Diptera: Platypezidae) and phylogeny of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Nearctic species of Callomyia Meigen (Diptera: Platypezidae) and phylogeny of the genus

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of
Callomyia
species in North America

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Abdomen with yellow or brownish-yellow markings; if silver-blue markings present, restricted to tergite 5 ............... 2

- Abdomen dark brown to black, without yellow or brownish-yellow markings; silver-grey, silver bluish-grey, silver-blue or metallic bluish-white markings usually present.............................................................. 4

2 . Yellow markings on abdomen more brownish-yellow ( Figs 9 , 19 ); tergite 5 without silver-blue markings; hind tarsomere 1 long and narrow, slightly narrower than apical width of hind tibia; hypandrial process with long finger-like basoventral lobe (
Fig. 59
)..................................................................................
C . calla Kessel

- Yellow markings on abdomen yellow to bright yellow ( Figs 7 , 14 , 8 , 24 ); tergite 5 usually with lateral to anterolateral silverblue markings ( Figs 7 , 14 ); hind tarsomere 1 thicker, subequal to or slightly broader than apical width of hind tibia; hypandrial process with shorter basoventral lobe ( Figs 58 , 64 )........................................................... 3

3 . Lemon yellow markings on abdominal tergites 1–4 ( Figs 7 , 18 ); sternite 8 yellow; hind tarsomere 1 length approximately
2 X
width, slightly broader than apical width of hind tibia; molar-like surstylus in posterior view with ventral inner cusp broadly truncate medially (
Fig. 66
)........................................................
C. browni Cumming
sp. nov.

- Yellow markings only on abdominal tergites 1–3 ( Figs 14 , 24 ), sometimes only on tergites 1–2 ; sternite 8 brown to grey; hind tarsomere 1 length approximately 2.5 X width, subequal to apical width of hind tibia; molar-like surstylus in posterior view with ventral inner cusp more narrowly truncate medially (
Fig. 69
)..................................
C . venusta Snow

5 . Metallic bluish-white markings on abdominal tergites 1–4 and 6 ( Figs 5, 6 ); legs mainly brown (
Fig. 5
); halter dark brown; surstylus broadly lamellate with narrow ventral process, hypandrial process trifid (
Fig. 56
)......
C . arnaudi Cumming
sp. nov.

6 . Abdomen primarily dark brown to black with silver-grey markings (when present) restricted to tergites 1 and 2 or tergites 3 and 4 ( Figs 12, 13 )..................................................................................... 7
